chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
P: code
Q: (nat * list X)%type
i: nat

Goal:
P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q

Premises:
code = (nat * list X)%type : Type
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
in_code = fun (i : nat) P => code_start P <= i < code_end P : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments in_code _%nat_scope _ /
subcode_start_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
in_out_code : forall (i : nat) P, in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
subcode_trans : forall P (Q R : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> Q <sc R -> P <sc R
subcode_length : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> code_start Q <= code_start P /\ code_end P <= code_end Q
subcode_length_le : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> fst Q <= fst P /\ fst P + length (snd P) <= fst Q + length (snd Q)
subcode_length' : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
ZifyClasses.rew_iff : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
subcode = fun P (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : code -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode _ _ /
out_code = fun (i : nat) P => i < code_start P \/ code_end P <= i : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments out_code _%nat_scope _ /
subcode_cons_inj : forall (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) P, (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
subcode_refl : forall P, P <sc P
code_start = fun P => fst P : code -> nat Arguments code_start _ /
code_end = fun P => fst P + length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_end _ /
in_out_code_dec : forall (i : nat) P, {in_code i P} + {out_code i P}
interval_dec : forall a b i : nat, {a <= i < b} + {i < a \/ b <= i}
code_length = fun P => length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_length _ /
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope
QArith_base.to_decimal = fun q : QArith_base.Q => let choose_exponent := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let i0 := match i with | Decimal.Pos i0 | Decimal.Neg i0 => i0 end in let li := Decimal.nb_digits i0 in let le := Decimal.nb_digits (Nat.to_uint ne) in li + le <? ne in let decimal_exponent := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let e := BinInt.Z.to_int (BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.of_nat ne)) in Decimal.DecimalExp i Decimal.Nil e in let decimal_dot := fun (i : Decimal.int) (ne : nat) => let ai := match i with | Decimal.Pos i0 | Decimal.Neg i0 => i0 end in let ni := Decimal.nb_digits ai in if ne <? ni then let i0 := Decimal.del_tail_int ne i in let f := Decimal.del_head (ni - ne) ai in Decimal.Decimal i0 f else let z := match i with | Decimal.Pos _ => Decimal.Pos (Decimal.D0 Decimal.Nil) | Decimal.Neg _ => Decimal...
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)

Tauto.ror_clause_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) * list Annot
Ring_polynom.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> list R -> Prop
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
partition : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A * list A
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Tauto.ror_cnf : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot * list Annot
Tauto.ror_clause : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot + list Annot
combine : forall A B : Type, list A -> list B -> list (A * B)
Tauto.ror_cnf_opt : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot * list Annot
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
split : forall A B : Type, list (A * B) -> list A * list B
Tauto.rxcnf : forall Term Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> (Term -> Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot) -> (Term -> Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot) -> forall TX AF : Type, bool -> Tauto.TFormula Term Annot TX AF -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot * list Annot
Tauto.ratom : forall Term' Annot : Type, Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot * list Annot
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.POneSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.PNSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall cdiv : C -> C ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P1) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.PNSubstL cO cI cadd cmul ceqb cdiv P1 LM1 m n))

Ring_polynom.norm_subst_spec : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.norm_subst cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb cdiv n lmp pe))

``` 
intros.
intros H1 H2.
unfold in_code.
unfold in_code in H2.
intros H3.
apply subcode_start_in_code with (P:=P) in H2.
apply H1.
apply H2.
apply H3. 
```

original: intros. intros H1 H2. unfold in_code. unfold in_code in H2. intros H3. apply subcode_start_in_code with (P:=P) in H2. apply H1. apply H2. apply H3.
